description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ome6","text":"2023 NUS-Singapore iGEM team followed this protocol to combine DNA fragments with overlapping regions, thereby reducing the number of fragments used in the Gibson Assembly and thus, improving the success rate of the Gibson Assembly. These overlapping regions are created during the PCR procedures by designing forward and reverse primers for each fragment to contain overlapping sequences.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"1nfdr","text":"This protocol outlines a general method for combining two DNA fragments with overlapping regions through overlap PCR. The number of fragments to be overlapped can be increased by adjusting the volume ratio between each DNA fragment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d5k7j","text":"Determine the volume ratio for each DNA fragment required in the reaction to calculate the appropriate volume for each DNA fragment. The final sample volume is  , with   being the KOD OneTM PCR Master Mix (Blue). Therefore, the remaining volume ( ) will be allocated to the gene fragments and DI Water for topping it up. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":168,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":246,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cbajj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2l530","text":"*This calculation requires the fragment size and the concentration of the target DNA fragments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"47","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"22","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jjug","text":"Divide the bigger fragment size by the smaller fragment size to get the volume ratio of the DNA fragment with the bigger fragment size.                      ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fg3ua","text":"Divide the concentration of the bigger fragment by the answer obtained in the previous step.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pd2r","text":"Divide the number obtained by the concentration of the smaller fragment to get the volume ratio of the DNA fragment with the smaller fragment size.                      ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0ss","text":"The volume ratio of each fragment may be adjusted to reach the final sample volume of   (DI water will be used to top up the remaining volume).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":86,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5r5iu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"47","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brop0","text":"Make the   PCR sample by adding the following into a PCR tube:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fh7ok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e303a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bivi9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"47","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Item","Volume"],"colWidths":["252","266"],"data":[["KOD OneTM PCR Master Mix (Blue)","25μL"],["DNA Fragment 1","From Calculation"],["DNA Fragment 2","From Calculation"],["DI Water","Top up the solution to 47μL"]],"guid":"C12551D8C919408680A1DABF70B9FAF4","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["KOD OneTM PCR Master Mix (Blue)","25μL"],["DNA Fragment 1","From Calculation"],["DNA Fragment 2","From Calculation"],["DI Water","Top up the solution to 47μL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"pshp","text":"In Step 5 of the above condition, the \"Extension\" step, quickly add   of each primer into the PCR tube before the 5-minute duration is completed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":68,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d1fak","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5n1o6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cce9k","text":"After Step 3, the 2 DNA fragments should have already been combined together. To amplify this combined gene, 2 primers are required. One of the primers should bind to the 5' end of the combined gene, while another primer should bind to the 3' end of the combined gene.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6qb11","text":"Proceeds to the gel electrophoresis to isolate the combined gene fragment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
